setup.common.beginning.step1: Connect the gateway to the Internet Box using the two cables provided (RJ45 and USB)
setup.common.beginning.step1.footer: The two LEDs of the gateway must light up and be fixed:
setup.common.beginning.step1.footer.li1: The left power indicator indicates that the gateway is well powered
setup.common.beginning.step1.footer.li2: The communication indicator on the right indicates good internet communication
setup.common.beginning.step2: On the thermostat, remove the battery protection tab
setup.common.beginning.step2.footer: A ✅ symbol then appears on the thermostat screen, indicating the correct starting of the product.
setup.common.beginning.step3: Turn off the general power to the housing to avoid any risk of electric shock
setup.common.end.step2.footer: The power indicator of the heating module(s) must be on and the communication icon must flash, indicating a request to be associated with the thermostat.
setup.common.end.step3.thermowire: Pilot wire: put your radiators in programming mode
setup.common.end.step3.thermodry: Dry contact: check that the heating part is activated
setup.common.end.step4: Bring the thermostat closer to the heating module
setup.common.end.step5: Wake up the COMAP CSH Thermostat
setup.common.end.step6: Remove the base of the thermostat by unclipping it
setup.common.end.step7: Attach the base to the wall with screws and dowels
setup.common.end.step8: Close the thermostat by clipping it in
setup.common.formElements.title.singular:
Check that you have this
element of your pack next to you,
setup.common.formElements.title.plurial: Check that you have all the elements of your pack next to you
setup.common.radiogroup.connected.conten:
More savings and simplified programming with
simplified programming with
thermal learning and
advanced weather forecasting.
setup.common.radiogroup.connected.title: Connected
setup.common.radiogroup.independent.cont:
Be freed from the constraints of
programming. Your thermostat
optimizes its program continuously
thanks to the learning of your
lifestyle.
setup.select.kitType.title: What products do you want to install?
setup.pageHeader.title: Installation
setup.stepHeader.title: Installation
setup.error.modal412.step1: Oops, your module can't reach our server...
setup.kit.thermostatic2: Move over the wheel surrounding the head by pushing it forward
setup.kit.thermostatic3: If it's a new set up, write down the serial number of one head. You should find it under the barcode which is on the tag placed under ther head
setup.kit.thermostatic4: Add an adaptator if necessary, if not go to next step
setup.kit.thermostatic4.universalKit: If your valve has a thread but the head nut does not screw because it is too large, screw the M30/M28 adapter if you have a universal kit.
setup.kit.thermostatic4.danfoss: Your insert or thermostatic body is of the Danfoss RA type: separate the two plastic parts from the adapter. Screw the Danfoss adapter corresponding to your model onto the radiator tube.
setup.kit.thermostatic5: Place the COMAP head in front of the radiator tap: you must read COMAP in the right direction.
setup.kit.thermostatic6: Screw the metal ring clockwise until the head is attached to the radiator. Tighten with a wrench.
setup.kit.thermostatic7: Insert the batteries into the head and replace the steering wheel.
setup.kit.thermostatic7.a: Insert the batteries in the direction indicated on the plastic bag.
setup.kit.thermostatic7.b: Slide the handwheel over the head, paying attention to the grooves (single groove on top, double groove on bottom).
setup.form.serialNumber.title:
To start, enter the
serial number of your product,
with 10 or 12 characters
setup.form.serialNumber.help: Where can I find my serial number?
setup.form.step.succes.head: Well done!
setup.form.step.succes.title:
You have completed the installation of
your starter kit
setup.form.tools.title: We will guide you step by step
setup.form.tools.instruction: Do you know the following tools:
setup.form.tools.warning:
The installation requires a power failure,
you can download the manual if necessary.
setup.kit.thermoWire.step3: Fix the base of the heating module with the plugs and screws
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step1: Remove the front panel of the old thermostat
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step2: Unplug your old thermostat and remove the base
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step3: Open the heating module by unclipping the back
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step4: Open the protective cover, unscrew the screw from the protective cover with a Torx 8 screwdriver and run the wires through the hole in the base
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step4.header: Currently in your home you have...
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step5.question: How many wires do you have on your thermostat?
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step5.footer: Generally the Phase wire (L) is red and the Neutral wire (N) is blue.
setup.kit.thermoDry-wired.step6: Fix the base of the heating module with the plugs and screws
setup.kit.thermoDry-none.step1: Connect the module to the heating system. To install it, open the protective cover of your boiler (using its manual if necessary). Locate the connection terminal block of the room thermostat
setup.kit.thermoDry-none.step1.footer: Note: Some thermostats are connected to an input different from the above list (eBus or EMS for example). In this case, you will need to identify the thermostat input TA, LS-LR or RT-24
setup.kit.thermoDry-none.step2: Connect terminals L (phase) and N (neutral) of the heating module to terminals L and N of the boiler or connection box. This will power the heating module
setup.kit.thermoDry-none.step3: Fix the base of the heating module with the plugs and screws
setup.serialNumber.findTitle: Where can i find my serial number (SN) ?
setup.serialNumber.findV1: Or inside the plate which close the module
